greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Larger of super amicable pair m < n defined by sigma(sigma(m)) = sigma(sigma(n)) = m + n.
comment: The terms are ordered according to the their lesser counterparts (A324255).
Analogous to A002046 as A019279 is analogous to A000396.
example: (23, 37) are the first pair since sigma(sigma(23)) = sigma(sigma(37)) = 60 = 23 + 37.
mathematica: seq={}; s[n_]:=DivisorSigma[1,DivisorSigma[1,n]]-n; Do[m=s[n];If[m>n && s[m]==n, AppendTo[seq, m]], {n,1,60000}]; seq
program: lista(nn) = {for (n=1, nn, my(fn = f(n)); if ((fn > n) && (f(fn) == n), print1(fn, ", ")););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 20 2019
results.author: _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 19 2019
